definition: to get the ball rolling (abbr. for 拋磚引玉|抛砖引玉[pao1 zhuan1 yin3 yu4])
to throw/to toss/to fling/to cast/to abandon
brick/CL:塊|块[kuai4]
variant of 磚|砖[zhuan1]
variant of 甎|砖[zhuan1]
lit. throw out a brick and get jade thrown back (idiom)/fig. to attract others' interest or suggestions by putting forward one's own modest ideas to get the ball rolling

sentences.english: In doing this, more people will be inspired and encouraged to write.
sentences.chinese: 如此抛砖引玉，能激发与鼓励更多人加入写作队伍。

sentences.english: The above is only the power of the individual peep-hole view, thoughtful.
sentences.chinese: 以上只是个人的了一孔之见，权当抛砖引玉。

sentences.english: I'll probably do the guttering or something.
sentences.chinese: 我很可能会做些抛砖引玉的工作。

sentences.english: This research will help more and more people to study sculptural process aesthetics in the future.
sentences.chinese: 这将为以后的雕塑过程美学研究抛砖引玉。

sentences.english: Common examples include solid linear brick and solid parabolic tetrahedral elements.
sentences.chinese: 常见的例子包括固体线性抛砖和固体四面体组成部分。

definition: lit. throw out a brick and get jade thrown back (idiom)/fig. to attract others' interest or suggestions by putting forward one's own modest ideas to get the ball rolling
lit. a brick thrown to prompt others to produce a jade (idiom)/fig. a modest suggestion intended to prompt others to come forward with better ideas
partial view/limited outlook
to just talk for the sake of talking
(polite) please amend my writing
to venture to/to presume to/to take the liberty of
learned person/expert in a certain field/abbr. to 方家[fang1 jia1]
my unworthy opinion (humble expr.)
shallow opinion/humble opinion
to pick up what others say (idiom); to pass off other people's opinions as one's own/to parrot
my humble opinion
(courteous) to be so bold as to
my unworthy manuscript (humble expr.)/my humble writing
(my) humble opinion/humble idea
to provide as expedient/to use temporarily as/to make shift
to be ridiculous/to make a fool of oneself
